Name: Widespread: decision making forums open to all adults
Description: Widespread: decision making forums open to all adults and involvement is relatively great

Name: High or some:  excluded basis on gender, age, or kinship
Description: High or some: widespread for some groups, but exclusion of others on the basis of gender, age, or kinship status

Name: Moderate:some consultation present, low input from community
Description: Moderate: some consultation present but low input from community

Name: Lowor non-existent: Leaders make most decisions
Description: Low or non-existent: Leaders make most decisions and involvement of average person highly limited or absent

Name: Endemic: a reality of daily existence (ex. fueding)
Description: Endemic: a reality of daily existence (e.g., physical violence, feuding, bitter factionalism)

Name: High: Conflict present, not a pervasive aspect of daily life
Description: High: Conflict present but not a pervasive aspect of daily life

Name: Moderate: Disagreements do not result in high violence
Description: Moderate: Disagreements and differences do not result in high violence or severe disruption

Name: Endemic: High physical violence, feuding, and/or raiding
Description: Endemic: High physical violence, feuding, and/or raiding occur regularly

Name: Moderately High, often involving physical violence
Description: Moderately High, often involving physical violence

Name: Moderate: Disputes may occur regularly, but manage w/ peace
Description: Moderate: Disputes may occur regularly but tendency to manage them in a more or less peaceful manner

Name: Conflicting partiesfind solution on their own
Description: Conflicting parties encouraged to find a solution on their own

Name: Conflicting party resolve disputes using informal mechanisms
Description: Conflicting parties easily draw new parties in but pressures for resolving disputes using informal mechanisms

Name: Authorities often get invloved to achieve a settlement
Description: Authorities often get involved and work to achieve a settlement

Name: Frequent involvement in litigation by society members
Description: Frequent involvement in litigation by society members

Name: Common
Description: Common, at least every five years

Name: Common
Description: Common, at least every five years

Name: done by leaders
Description: Not specialized but done by leaders who do other things as well

Name: Absent
Description: Absent, or carried out by social pressure of wider community

Name: Especially high
Description: Especially high -- uniformly high across groups

Name: High for the most part
Description: High for the most part across groups in the society

Name: Moderate
Description: Moderate -- some noticeable variation across groups in society

Name: low
Description: Low -- not terribly salient or rarely important as a concern

Name: Extensive
Description: Extensive: bitter feelings toward almost all outsiders

Name: high
Description: High: bitter feelings toward outsiders, but not always

Name: Moderate
Description: Moderate: sometimes bitter feelings, but much differentiation

Name: Regular Taxes
Description: Regular and non-negligible taxes to community

Name: Only in special cases, modest
Description: Only in special situations or Modest level

Name: Often move to another community
Description: Often move to another community following disputes

Name: Sometimes
Description: Sometimes move to another community following disputes

Name: Rarely or never
Description: Rarely or never move to another community following disputes

Name: None
Description: Adults generally attached to particular communities throughout their lives, especially after marriage

Name: Occasionally
Description: Individuals occasionally move to new communities as adults

Name: Common
Description: Movement between communities is quite common for adults

Name: Frequent
Description: Frequent, through trade, warfare, travel, etc.

Name: No Political links
Description: No politically relevant links, formal organizations, or strong informal obligations which extend beyond the local community

Name: Some links
Description: Some politically relevant ties, but wider society divided into some discrete groups not linked through cross-cutting ties

Name: Many links
Description: Cross-cutting ties link individuals throughout the society, cutting across territorial groups in one or more ways

Name: high
Description: High: in some situations equal to or greater than that of men

Name: Significant
Description: Significant but not as high as male involvement

Name: Not Great
Description: Not great but clearly some role for women in public aspects of political life

Name: Women excluded
Description: Women generally excluded from public aspects of politics

Name: high
Description: High: in some situations equal to or greater than that of men

Name: Significant
Description: Significant but not as high as male involvement

Name: Not Great
Description: Not great but clearly some role for women in private aspects of political life

Name: Not Involved
Description: Women do not seem to get involved in political life in private arenas

Name: None
Description: Women and men eligible for some of the same positions and women commonly do so

Name: Occasional
Description: Women and men eligible for some of the same positions and women occasionally do so

Name: Rarely if ever
Description: Women rarely, if ever, hold some of the same positions regardless of rules of eligibility

Name: Women excluded
Description: The same political positions are not open to both women and men

Name: Some Associations
Description: Some associations or organizations under exclusive control of women

Name: Some Positions
Description: No associations but some positions of authority for which only women are eligible

Name: None
Description: No associations or positions exclusively controlled by women

Name: high
Description: Especially high -- judgments not difficult to make

Name: Good
Description: Good -- some missing data, those available seemed good

Name: Moderate
Description: Moderate but acceptable -- a good deal of inference sometimes required

Name: Weak
Description: Weak for certain variables with much missing data and only the most general descriptions for some domains

Name: No
Description: No (but not distinguished from missing data)

Name: Yes
Description: Yes be clearly distinguished from cases where the verification efforts identified by the codes were not used.]

Name: No
Description: No (but not distinguished from missing data)

Name: No
Description: No (but not distinguished from missing data)

Name: No
Description: No (but not distinguished from missing data)

Name: Not Approved
Description: Not approved or admired by parents or authorities. Mild forms (e.g. sexual jokes) sometimes approved.

Name: Normally Approved
Description: Normally and generally approved [by parents, etc.]. Moderate frequency, intensity, importance, variety

Name: Strongly Approved
Description: Strongly approved and valued [by parents, etc.]. High frequency, variety of sexual behavior admired.

Name: Not Approved
Description: Not approved or admired by parents or authorities. Mild forms (e.g. sexual jokes) sometimes approved.

Name: Normally Approved
Description: Normally and generally approved [by parents, etc.]. Moderate frequency, intensity, importance, variety

Name: Strongly Approved
Description: Strongly approved and valued [by parents, etc.]. High frequency, variety of sexual behavior admired.

Name: Disapproved & Punished
Description: Disapproved and punished mildly and inconsistent

Name: Disapproved & Punished
Description: Disapproved and punished mildly and inconsistent

Name: Low, Mostly the Same
Description: Low, mostly the same, no formal transition. Frequent companionship between the two stages

Name: Substantial but Inconsistent
Description: Substantial, but inconsistent, not formalized, or companionship only for some activities

Name: High with Formal Transition
Description: High, with formal transition. Infrequent companionship with younger children.

Name: Low, Mostly the Same
Description: Low, mostly the same, no formal transition. Frequent companionship between the two stages

Name: Substantial, but Inconsistent
Description: Substantial, but inconsistent, not formalized, or companionship only for some activities

Name: High, with Formal Transition
Description: High, with formal transition. Infrequent companionship with younger children.

Name: Three or more levels of supra-community integration
Description: Three or more levels of supra-community integration

Name: Nonlineal/bilateral,i.e. w/o lineages though often w/kindred
Description: Nonlineal or bilateral, i.e., without lineages though often with personal kindreds

Name: Matrilineal, predominantly avunculocal residence, w/Patrilineal second
Description: Matrilineal, predominantly avunculocal residence, with Patrilineal secondary

Name: Monogamy preferred, but exceptional cases of polygyny
Description: Monogamy preferred, but exceptional cases of polygyny

Name: Polygyny preferred by men with leadership attributes(chiefs)
Description: Polygyny preferred by individual men with leadership attributes (chiefs, medicine men, outstanding hunters)

Name: Polygyny preferred by men of higher social class(wealth etc)
Description: Polygyny preferred by men of a higher social class: men of wealth, rank, nobility, etc.

Name: Polygyny preferred by most men, to obtain wives
Description: Polygyny preferred by most men, and attained by most men of sufficient years or wealth to obtain wives. Thus: (a) older men usually have more wives; (b) polygyny is generally based on the accumulation of wealth; and (c) extra wives are an economic asset in terms of labor.

Name: Monogamy preferred, but exceptional cases of polygyny
Description: Monogamy preferred, but exceptional cases of polygyny

Name: Limited polygyny <20% of married males
Description: Limited polygyny < 20 pct of married males

Name: Full polygyny 20% or more of married males
Description: Full polygyny 20 pct or more of married males

Name: Non-sororal polygyny predominant
Description: Non-sororal polygyny predominant (Atlas PQ) (sororal may or may not be permitted)

Name: Sororal or marriage to wife's kin predominant
Description: Sororal or marriage to wifes kin predominant (Atlas RS)

Name: Sororal or secondary marriage to wife's kin only
Description: Sororal or secondary marriage to wifes kin only

Name: One wife resides w/husband others in separate houses
Description: One wife resides with husband, others in separate houses

Name: One wife resides w/husband, others in separate community
Description: One wife resides with husband, others in separate communities

Name: Separate housing in compound for every wife
Description: Separate housing in compound for every wife (Atlas QS)

Name: Separate housing in village for every wife
Description: Separate housing in village for every wife [as might occur, for example, with mens houses, e.g., Otoro - check]

Name: Wife sleeps in same room with husband
Description: Wife sleeps in same room with husband

Name: Wife sleeps in room apart from husband's room
Description: Wife sleeps in room apart from husbands room, including cases of mens dormitories or 30 pct or more polygynously married women if co-wives sleep apart (e.g., Trobriand chiefs wives constitute circa 39 pct of the married women)

Name: Husband has no room apart
Description: Husband has no room apart (dominant pattern, e.g., for Trobriand commoners)

Name: Husband has a room apart, even if rotates among wives
Description: Husband has a room apart, even if rotates among wives

Name: Hereditary upper social class
Description: Hereditary upper social class (note: incompletely coded)

Name: Yes, or Leaders have more wives than commoners
Description: Yes, or Leaders have more wives than commoners

Name: Women taken as captives but not married
Description: Women taken as captives but not married

Name: Direct percentage for make polygyny, 2 wives per man
Description: Direct percentages for male polygyny, female polygyny estimated for minimum of two wives per man, where if P = % men married polygynously then Q = 2P / 100+P is the % women married polygynously

Name: % female polygyny estimated from ethno. Notes
Description: Percentage female polygyny estimated from ratios of men with different numbers of wives, provided by ethnographer

Name: Lower of 2+ censuses, or estimates where reason
Description: Lower of two or more censuses used, or estimates where there is some other reason to believe that true percentages are higher for both males and females

Name: Estimates from 0 to 5% male polygyny inferred, then doubled to estimate female
Description: Estimates from 0 to 5 pct male polygyny inferred from statements about limited polygyny; these are doubled for female percentages (a minimal estimate)

Name: Sample of less 100 married men, of an entire settlement
Description: Sample of less than 100 married men, but of an entire settlement

Name: Estimate by Inference from Ethnographer Statements
Description: Estimate by Inference from Ethnographer Statements

Name: Marriage of female captives (858), plus above
Description: Marriage of female captives (858), plus above

Name: Present2
Description: Present - with characteristics of the Healer, but not

Name: Present
Description: Present (Note: the Roman practitioner known as a

Name: Friends, Family, Lineage, Clan
Description: None of above: but men organized as friends, family, lineage,clan

Name: Taken by Official or Council of the Political Community
Description: Taken by official or council of the political community

Name: War is continual
Description: War is not ended but is continual

Name: High
Description: High, with any one of the following present: Subjugation of territory or people (909) Collection of tribute (910) Land - fields, hunting/fishing territory, pastures (911) Trophies and honors (including captives for sacrifice) (913)

Name: low
Description: Low, absence of any of the above

Name: High
Description: High, with any one of the following present: Subjugation of territory or people (909) Collection of tribute (910) Land - fields, hunting/fishing territory, pastures (911)

Name: low
Description: Low, absence of any of the above

Name: An Official Backed by Force
Description: An official who could back up his decision by force

Name: Informal Leader Obeyed by Respect
Description: An informal leader whom people obeyed because of respect, but who had no means to force warriors to obey

Name: A Great Deal; Important for every male
Description: A great deal; important for every male

Name: Some, not necessary to be a Warrior to have Influence
Description: some, not necessary to be a warrior to have influence in the community

Name: No Special Respect for Man who Fights
Description: No special consideration, respect, or distinctions for a man who fights

Name: Enjoyed and Has High Value
Description: Enjoyed and considered to have high value

Name: Considered a Necessary Evil
Description: Considered to be a necessary evil

Name: Avoided, Denounced, Not Engaged In
Description: Consistently avoided, denounced, not engaged in

Name: No Change
Description: No change -- boundaries/population stationary (the population is able to replace those lost in war)

Name: Breaking Evan, Territory Lost is Taken From Others
Description: Breaking even -- what it loses in territory it takes from others

Name: No data on rates of manumission, hereditary slaveholding
Description: No data on rates of manumission, but hereditary slaveholding is present by Pattersons definition

Name: Herdit. nt prest. Patterson def, prest. Murdock defintion
Description: Hereditary slaveholding not present by Pattersons definition, although present by Murdocks definition

Name: Heredit. slaveholding not preset Patterson, preset Murdock
Description: Hereditary slaveholding not present by Pattersons definition, although slavery present by Murdocks definition, unascertained as to whether hereditary

Name: Not present Patterson def. Nonherdit. present Murdock
Description: Hereditary slaveholding not present by Pattersons definition, although nonhereditary slavery present (e.g., slaves captured in warfare but not inherited) by Murdocks definition.

Name: Slavery not present by either definition
Description: Slavery not present by either definition

Name: Slavery not present by either, but societies have ex-slave
Description: Slavery not present by either definition, although the societies are largely composed of former slaves.

Name: Present at or immediate proir to pinpointing date
Description: Present at or immediate prior to pinpointing date

Name: Present within past one hundred years
Description: Present within past one hundred yesrs

Name: Present within past two hundred years
Description: Present within past two hundred years

Name: Present within past htree hundred years
Description: Present within past three hundred years

Name: The amount, style, color, or material of garment worn
Description: The amount, style, color, or material of the garment worn

Name: Paraphernalia (belts, footwear, headgear)
Description: Paraphernalia, e.g., belts, footwear, headgear and other accessories to the main garment, exclusive of jewelry

Name: The amount, style, or placement of jewelry
Description: The amount, style, or placement of jewelry

Name: The style, lenght, or color of head hair
Description: The style, length, or color of head hair

Name: The use of cosmetics
Description: The use of cosmetics, i.e., preparations applied to specific parts of the body to enhance their attractiveness, e.g., facial makeup, body scents, body oils, body paints, tooth blackeners

Name: Removal of body hair
Description: The removal of body hair, exclusive of head hair coded under 4, e.g., the removal of facial, axillary, or pubic hair

Name: Deformation or mutilization of the body
Description: The deformation or mutilization of the body, exclusive of the genitals, i.e., a change in the form or the removal of a material part of the body, e.g., tattooing, cicatrization, cranial deformation, ear piercing

Name: The amount, style, color, or material of garment worn
Description: The amount, style, color, or material of the garment worn

Name: Paraphernalia (belts, footwear, headgear)
Description: Paraphernalia, e.g., belts, footwear, headgear and other accessories to the main garment, exclusive of jewelry

Name: The amount, style, or placement of jewelry
Description: The amount, style, or placement of jewelry

Name: The style, lenght, or color of head hair
Description: The style, length, or color of head hair

Name: The growth of facial hair (moustaches and beards)
Description: The growth of facial hair, e.g., moustaches and beards

Name: The use of cosmetics
Description: The use of cosmetics, i.e., preparations applied to specific parts of the body to enhance their attractiveness, e.g., facial makeup, body scents, body oils, body paints, tooth blackeners

Name: Removal of body hair
Description: The removal of body hair, exclusive of head hair coded under 4, e.g., the removal of facial, axillary, or pubic hair

Name: Deformation or mutilization of the body
Description: The deformation or mutilization of the body, exclusive of the genitals, i.e., a change in the form or the removal of a material part of the body, e.g., tattooing, cicatrization, cranial deformation, ear piercing

Name: Deformation or mutiliation of the genitals
Description: The deformation or mutiliation of the genitals, e.g., clitoridectomy, circumcision, sewing the labia together

Name: Girls marry before or at puberty & live with husband
Description: Girls marry before or very soon after puberty and live in the dwelling of their prospective husband

Name: Sleep in same dwelling as parents & sibs
Description: Girls sleep in the same dwelling as their parents and sibs No special section reported for them

Name: In Parents but separate area
Description: Girls sleep in the same dwelling as their parents but in a particular section or partitioned area for them and/or their female siblings

Name: In Parents but with mother
Description: Girls sleep in the same dwelling as their parents but in a particular section for their mothers and female children Males sleep in a separate section

Name: In Parents but only with girls
Description: Girls sleep in the same dwelling as their parents with no partition reported, but the adolescent males sleep in a separate section

Name: In Parents but males outside
Description: Girls sleep in the same dwelling as their parents with no partition reported, but the adolescent males sleep in a mens house or somewhere other than the natal dwelling

Name: In Parents but separate area & males outside
Description: Girls sleep in the same dwelling as their parents. There is a special or partitioned area for them. The adolescent males sleep elsewhere

Name: With Mother, males elsewhere outside
Description: Girls sleep in the same dwelling as their mother, but adolescent and other mature males sleep elsewhere

Name: Girls in own hut, boys in theirs
Description: Girls sleep in their own hut or separate dwelling for adolescent girls. Adolescent boys sleep in a mens house or some dwelling other than the one in which their parents reside

Name: Together
Description: W (wife) sleeps with her H (husband) in their own dwelling No rooms or partitions between them are specified

Name: Together_duplicated_2
Description: W sleeps with her H in a dwelling that contains more than one conjugal family. No partitioned area reported for them

Name: Together_duplicated_3
Description: W sleeps with her H in a partitioned area in dwelling that contains more than one conjugal family

Name: Togeth but Men's House
Description: W sleeps with her H in her dwelling, but he has a dwelling of his own or spends most of his time in the mens house or elsewhere, e.g., with another wife

Name: Wife's Room
Description: W sleeps with her H in her own room or section of the dwelling, separate from the section of her H

Name: Men's House
Description: W sleeps in her dwelling, and her H sleeps in his dwelling or in a mens house except for the times when intercourse is desired

Name: Men & women eat together. No particular arrangement is set.
Description: Men and women eat together. No particular arrangement is specified for the sexes

Name: Men & women eat together. position accroding to kinship.
Description: Men and women eat together. There is a strict positioning of them in the eating area, e.g., positioning according to kinship

Name: Men & women dont' eat together in public,may do in pirvate
Description: Men and women do not eat together in public but certain kin may eat together in private, e.g., husband and wife

Name: Men & women do not eat togethe & eat in different areas
Description: Men and women do not eat together and eat in different areas

Name: Men & women do not eat together; they eat  diffferent times
Description: Men and women do not eat together; the separation is accomplished by their eating at different times

Name: No ordeal reported but may be a change in physical outlook
Description: There is no ordeal reported although there may be a change in physical appearance, living arrangements, or name

Name: Slight ordeal, a relaxed period of seclusion, eating taboos
Description: Three is a slight ordeal involved, e.g., a very short or relaxed period of seclusion, a few minor eating taboos, etc

Name: Moderate ordeal,strict seclusion ,restraint of movement,
Description: There is a moderate ordeal involved, e.g., a strict period of seclusion, restaints on movement, numerous eating taboos, etc

Name: Severe ordeal,painful physical operation.lenghty seclusion
Description: There is a severe ordeal involved, e.g., a painful physical operation such as clitoridectomy, a lengthy seclusion with numerous taboos on movement, eating and social contacts, etc

Name: There is no celebration of any kind
Description: There is no celebration of any kind

Name: There is a small celebration, the family group has a party
Description: There is a small celebration, e.g., the family group has a party

Name: Moderate party,family,friends have a feast ,dance,give gifts
Description: There is a moderate celebration, e.g., family, friends, and/or small kin group have a feast, dance, give gifts

Name: Elaborate celebration,community,kin group celebrate a while
Description: There is an elaborate celebration, e.g., the community, a large kin group, or other large social grouping celebrate or a smaller group has a celebration for an extended period of time

Name: Not especially significant beyond change in dress, name, etc
Description: It is not thought to be especially significant beyond a change in dress, name, etc

Name: Main significant she is adult w/ more social responsiblity
Description: Its main significance is that she is an adult who has more social responsibilities

Name: Main significant she is capable of having intercourse
Description: The main significance is that she is now capable of having intercourse, wehther or not she actually engages in it

Name: Main significance she is eligible for marriage & have sex
Description: Its main significance is that she is eligible for marriage and can engage in intercourse

Name: Main significance is she is eligible for marriage
Description: Its main significance is that she is eligible for marriage

Name: Main significance she is eligible for marriage & is an adult
Description: Its main significance is that she is eligible for marriage and is an adult

Name: Main significance she is eligible for marriage & bear child.
Description: Its main significance is that she is eligible for marriage and is capable of bearing children

Name: Main singificance she is capable of bearing children
Description: Its main significance is that she is capable of bearing children

Name: No restriction during this period, carries out activities
Description: There is no restriction placed on her during this period, and she carries on her activities as usual

Name: Restrictions on personal activities not social
Description: There are restrictions placed on her personal activities but not on her social contacts, e.g., cooking taboos, eating taboos, taboos on what she may touch

Name: Restrictions on personal & social movements
Description: There are restrictions placed on her personal movements and social contacts, e.g., she must remain in her dwelling or in a certain area of the settlements, she should avoid certain people

Name: Few restrictions placed on her personal & social activities
Description: There are few restrictions placed on her personal activities and social contacts

Name: Moderate restrictions, may not cook,  see certain people
Description: There are moderate restrictions placed on her movements and her personal activities, e.g., she is in a partitioned area of the dwelling, she may not cook, she may see only certain people, she cannot engage in her usual economic activities, relaxed seclusion

Name: Severe restrictions, secluded in a menstrual hut
Description: There are severe restrictions imposed on her movements and personal activities, e.g., she is isolated in a menstrual hut, she may see few if any people, she may not cook, she may not feed herself

Name: No one is thought to be endangered during this period
Description: No one is thought to be endangered during this period

Name: Only the menstruating woman is endangered
Description: Only the menstruating woman is endangered

Name: The woman endagers men.
Description: The woman endangers men. If both 3 & 4, code as 4

Name: The woman endangers other womeen and/or children
Description: The woman endangers other women and/or children, e.g., the fertility of other women, newborn children

Name: The woman endangers anyone with whom she comes in contact
Description: The woman endangers anyone with whom she comes in contact

Name: The woman endangers her social group
Description: The woman endangers her social group, e.g., the fertility of the crops, the response of the supernatural to them, harm to an important social functionary
Some information, but insufficient to code

Name: She modifies usual garments she wears ex.loosefitting clothe
Description: She modifies the usual garments she wears and/or the usual care of her body, e.g., she wears more loosefitting garments, wears amulets to ward off evil spirits, pays special attention to cleanliness, etc

Name: She modifies the use of her sensory apparatus
Description: She modifies the use of her sensory apparatus, e.g., she avoids hearing, seeing, or touching certain things

Name: She modifies her diet ex.avoid eating certain foods
Description: She modifies her diet, e.g., she avoids eating certain foods

Name: She modifies her usual domestic or econimic duties
Description: She modifies her usual domestic or economic duties, e.g., she does not cook she has someone else care for the children

Name: She modifies her usual mobility
Description: She modifies her suaul mobility, e.g., she should not leave the settlement, she avoids certain places

Name: She modifies her usual social relations
Description: Her usual social relations and/or living arrangements are modifies, e.g., she may not sleep where she usually does, she cannot be near certain people, she must not behave in the usual manner

Name: She modifiies her participation on social groups & activitie
Description: She modifies her participation in social groups and activities, e.g., religious events

Name: They are to prevent harm to the baby
Description: They are to prevent harm to the baby

Name: They are to prevent harm to the mother ex difficult delivery
Description: They are to prevent harm to the mother, e.g, illness, difficult delivery

Name: They are to prevent harm to the baby adn the mother
Description: They are to prevent harm to the baby and the mother, e.g., miscarriage, attacks from the spirits, etc

Name: They are to prevent harm to anyone she comes in contact with
Description: They are to prevent harm to anyone with whom she comes in contact and/or the social group of which she is a part, e.g., to prevent failure of the crops, to prevent an epidemic

Name: No special place is prepared for the birth of the child
Description: No special place is prepared for the birth of the child; the woman gives birth wherever she happens to be

Name: The woman gives birth in her place of residence
Description: The woman gives birth in the dwelling where she usually resides, but no special partitions are set up

Name: The woman gives birth in her residence but in a special room
Description: The woman gives birth in the dwelling where she usually resides but in a partitioned or otherwise demarcated area or room

Name: The woman gives birth in a area near her residence
Description: The woman gives birth in an area near the dwelling where she usually resides, e.g., under the dwelling, in a lean-to near the dwelling

Name: The woman does not give birth in any special dwelling
Description: The woman does not give birth in a special dwelling but in a place outside of the area where most social activity occurs, e.g., on the fringes or outside of the dwelling area

Name: She gives birth in a structure constructed for the purpose
Description: The woman gives birth in a structure explicitly constructed for the purpose, e.g., a birth hut

Name: The woman gives birth at an affinal relative
Description: The woman does not give birth in her usual residence but in the dwelling of an affinal relative

Name: The woman gives birth at a consanguineal relative
Description: The woman does not give birth in her usual residence but in the dwelling of a consanguineal relative

Name: Restrictions are on her to promote safety for the child
Description: Restrictions are imposed on her to promote the well-being of her child, e.g., she is cared for so that she can produce milk for the baby

Name: Restrictions are imposed on her to prevent harm to her care
Description: Restrictions are imposed on her to prevent harm to her and/or to promote her well-being, e.g., other people prepare and bring her food, she does not work, she is indulged

Name: Restrictions are imposed to prevent harm to her & her baby
Description: Restrictions are imposed to prevent harm to her and her baby

Name: Restrictions are imposed to prevent harm to those around her
Description: Restrictions are imposed on her to prevent harm to those with whom she comes in contact and/or to prevent harm to her social group
Some information, but insufficient to code

Name: There is no celebration for the mother or child after birth
Description: There is no celebratin for the mother or child after birth

Name: There is no celebration after birth, offer congratulations
Description: There is no celebration after birth, but people do come to visit, offer congratulations, etc

Name: There is a minor celebration after birth, small meal, drinks
Description: There is a minor celebration after the birth, e.g, a small meal, a few drinks, etc

Name: There is moderate amont of celebration after birth, feast
Description: There is a moderate amount of celebration after the birth, e.g., a feast, dancing

Name: There is an elaborate celebration after the birth
Description: There is an elaborate celebration after the birth, e.g., elaborate feasting, dancing, many rites performed
Some information, but insufficient to code

Name: Immediately or a few days after delivery
Description: Immediately or a few days after delivery

Name: After the mother comes out of confinement
Description: After the mother comes out of confinement

Name: When the baby is named or baptized
Description: When the baby is named or baptized

Name: When the baby and mother come out of confinement
Description: When the baby and mother come out of confinement

Name: No one is involved in a celebration
Description: No one is involved in a celebration

Name: Friends of the H and W and "relatives"
Description: Friends of the H and W and relatives

Name: The W's and H's kin units of a group more extensive than fam
Description: The wifes and husbands kin units or relatives of a group more extensive than the family

Name: Community or large social, group which the H and W belong
Description: The community or large social, group to which the H and W belong

Name: They want very few children, regardless of sex
Description: They want very few children, regardless of sex

Name: They prefer to have males ranther than females
Description: They prefer to have males rather than females, regardless of sex

Name: They prefer to have females rather than males, regardless #
Description: They prefer to have females rather than males, regardless of number

Name: Either sex is acceptable,  healthy child wanted
Description: Either sex is acceptable, e.g., the father wants a boy, the mother wants a girl, or they dont care as long as the child is healthy

Name: They prefer a large number of children, regardless of sex
Description: They prefer a large number of children, regardless of their sex

Name: Barrenness is regarded as an unfortunate physical condition
Description: Barrenness is regarded as an unfortunate physical condition that has befallen a woman through no fault of her own

Name: Barrenness is regarded as the fault of others who has malice
Description: Barrenness is regarded as the fault of others who bear malice towards the woman, e.g., witches

Name: Barrenness is regarded as the fault of other who break taboo
Description: Barrenness is regarded as the fault of others who break taboos that have ramifications for her fertility

Name: Barenness is regarded as the fault of supernatural forces
Description: Barrenness is regarded as the fault of supernatural forces or supernatural beings who are generally malevolent

Name: Barrenness is regarded as fault to the woman being punished
Description: Barrenness is regarded as the fault of the woman who is being punished for committing some offense which is not sexual in nature

Name: Barrenness is regarded as a punishment tto a woman
Description: Barrenness is regarded as punishment to a woman who has committed some sexual offense, e.g., adultery, incest

Name: Remedies are actively sought to correct the condition
Description: Remedies are actively sought to correct the condition, e.g., amulets, potions, ceremonies

Name: Provision is made for a child by adoption for fosterage
Description: Provision is made for a child by adoption for fosterage

Name: Provision tis made for a child, H takind 2nd wife
Description: Provision is made for a child by the husband taking an additional wife to bear children or by the wife getting another woman to bear children for her husband

Name: The woman's husband can or does divorce her
Description: The womans husband can or does divorce her

Name: The woman is ostracized b/c she has no children
Description: The woman is ostracized because she has no children, e.g., jokes are made about her. She is given a subsidiary role in domestic tasks

Name: No contraception is known about or used
Description: No contraception is known about or used

Name: Contraception is present, but there is no info on the method
Description: Contraception is present, but there is no information on the method

Name: There is a rudimentary form of contraception
Description: There is a rudimentary form of contraception, e.g., abstention when the woman is thought most likely to conceive, coitus interruptus

Name: Contraception is present by implication
Description: Contraception is present by implication, e.g., a long post-partum sex taboos or abstention while nursing

Name: There is a long post-partum sex taboos & rudimentary contra.
Description: There is a long post-partum sex taboos and rudimentary contraception

Name: There is a long post-partum sex taboos & the woman practice
Description: There is a long post-partum sex taboos and the woman practices some intentional form of contraception

Name: The woman is primarily responsible for contraception
Description: The woman is primarily responsible for contraception, e.g., she has knowledge of rites she can perform to prevent offspring or she has knowledge of rites she can perform to prevent offspring or she swallows a drug

Name: Occurs but no data on Frequency
Description: Abortions occur, but there is no information on frequency

Name: Permit & Frequent
Description: Abortions are permitted and occur frequently

Name: Disapprov & Occur
Description: Abortions are disapproved of but do occur. If they are infrequent and there is no information on approval, code in this category

Name: Disapprov & Rare
Description: Abortions are strongly disapproved of and occur rarely or never

Name: Concern for Mother
Description: Concern for the psychological or pgysical state of the mother, e.g., she does not want more children, she is concerned about her beauty, or she does not want to lose her husband

Name: Revenge on Husband
Description: Revenge, e.g., the woman is angry with her husband

Name: Concern for Child
Description: Concern for the childs welfare, e.g., the mother is nursing another which would leave no milk for another, or the couple cannot afford more children

Name: Out of Wedlock
Description: The child was conceived out of wedlock

Name: Illicit Relationship
Description: The child was conceived in an illicit sexual relationship, e.g., adulterous, incestuous, or with a man of the wrong social class or ethnic group

Name: Occurs but no data
Description: Infanticide occurs, but there is no information on frequency

Name: Premit & Frequent
Description: Infanticide is permitted and occurs frequently

Name: Permit & Infrequent
Description: Infanticide is permitted and occurs infrequently

Name: Disapprov & Occurs
Description: Infanticide is disapproved of but does occur. If it occurs, and there is no information on approval, code here

Name: Disapprov & no Occur
Description: Infanticide is disapproved and does not occur

Name: Mother's Welfare
Description: The mothers welfare, e.g., she does not want more children, she is afraid of losing her charms, etc

Name: Revenge on Husband
Description: Revenge, e.g., due to argument with husband

Name: Child's Welfare
Description: Concern for the childs welfare, e.g., the couple cannot support more children or there is ni one to suckle the child

Name: Child Deformed
Description: The child was born in an unusual position, exhibited some unusual behavior or physical trait at birth, or was deformed, e.g., hair was already present on the child, or the child was born feet first

Name: Multiple Birth
Description: The child was one of a multiple birth

Name: Illicit Relationship
Description: The child was born of an illicit sexual relationship, i.e., premarital, adulterous, or incestuous

Name: Not for a period after childbirth or during pregnancy
Description: It cannot occur for some period after childbirth whether because of nursing or a postpartum sex taboo and/or during pregnancy

Name: Not during menstruation, pregnancy or after child birth
Description: It cannot occur during mensturation and after childbirth and/or during pregnancy

Name: Not occur before, during, or after life cycle events
Description: It cannot occur before, during, or after life cycle events, e.g., after the death of a spouse or at initiation

Name: Not before, during, and/or after a military expedition
Description: It cannot occur before, during, and/or after a military expedition

Name: Not before, during, or after a major economic activity
Description: It cannot occur before, during and/or after a major economic activity and/or a manufacturing operation

Name: Not occur before, during and/or after a ritual program
Description: It cannot occur before, during and/or after a ritual program of some sort, e.g., days of abstinence of power seeking

Name: It cannot occur before, during and/or after non-life cycle
Description: It cannot occur before, during and/or after non-life cycle ceremonial events, e.g., harvest festivals

Name: No extention beyond the nuclear family is reported
Description: No extension beyond the nuclear family is reported. Note in the comments if the strongest prohibition in the family is Br-Si, Mo-So, or Fa-Dau

Name: Bilateral extensions by cross or parallel cousins
Description: Bilateral extensions by cross or parallel cousins

Name: Bilateral extension by degree of cousinage from ego
Description: Bilateral extension by degree of cousinage from ego

Name: Matrilineal extensions, with or without other bilateral ext.
Description: Matrilineal extensions, with or without other bilateral extensions

Name: Patrilineal extentions, with or w/out other bilateral exten.
Description: Patrilineal extensions, with or without other bilateral extensions

Name: Extensions based on nonkinship considerations
Description: Extensions based on nonkinship considerations, e.g., ritual bonds, household composition, locality, or social class

Name: None or mild punishment
Description: None or mild punishment, e.g., ostracism or a fine

Name: Moderate punishment
Description: Moderate punishment, e.g., offenders meet with misfortune such as sickness or bad luck

Name: Severe punishment
Description: Severe punishment, e.g., death, barrenness, or expulsion from the community

Name: Punishment ot others than the offenders
Description: Punishment to others than the offenders, e.g., their family or kin group

Name: Punishment ot the total social group
Description: Punishment to the total social group, e.g., an epidemic or crop failure in the community

Name: Punishment that affects the offenders and their social group
Description: Punishment that affects the offenders as well as their social group, i.e., category `2` or `3` in combination with `5` category

Name: It is permitted for both sexes
Description: It is permitted for both sexes

Name: It is permitted for both but in limited contexts
Description: It is permitted for both but in limited contexts, e.g., with prostitutes or as part of a ceremony

Name: It is permitted and not punished unless pregnancy results
Description: It is permitted and not punished unless pregnancy results

Name: It is permitted for males but not females
Description: It is permitted for males but no females

Name: Premarital relations are disaproved but not infrequent fact
Description: Premarital relations are disapproved but no infrequent in fact

Name: Insistence on virginity for the woman, no info on male
Description: Insistence on virginity for the woman. There is no information on restrictions on the male

Name: Premarital relations are strongly disapproved and rare
Description: Premarital relations are strongly disapproved and rare

Name: Neither she nor her partner face punishment
Description: Neither she nor her partner face punishment

Name: Her partner is punished, but she is not
Description: Her partner is punished, but she is not

Name: Mild punishment for the women
Description: Mild punishment for the women, e.g., temporary ostracism

Name: Moderate punishment for the woman
Description: Moderate punishment for the woman, e.g., marriage is more difficult or physical punishment

Name: Severe punishment, banished from social group or killed
Description: Severe punishment, e.g., banishment from her social group, or she is killed
[Kenuzi, Gheg, Kurd, Manus, Mbau] - Severe or killed ?

Name: Permitted for both H and W
Description: Permitted for both H and W

Name: Permitted for both but in limited context
Description: Permitted for both but only in limited contexts, e.g., with particular relatives of the spouse, ceremonial license

Name: Permitted and not punished unless pregnancy results
Description: Permitted and not punished unless pregnancy results

Name: Permitted for the husband but not for the wife
Description: Permitted for the husband but not for the wife

Name: Weakly prohibited
Description: Weakly prohibited, e.g., frequent violations or weak punishment

Name: Strongly prohibited
Description: Strongly prohibited, e.g., occurs rarely or severe punishment

Name: No or mild punishment
Description: No punishment or mild punishment, e.g., a warning or a fine

Name: Generally mild punishment
Description: Generally mild punishment, but she can be killed for it

Name: Moderate punishment, beating or incarceration
Description: Moderate punishment, e.g., a beating or incarceration

Name: Generally moderate punishment, she can be killed or divorced
Description: Generally moderate punishment, but she can be killed or divorced for it

Name: She is generally divorced, but can be killed for it
Description: She is generally divorced, but she can be killed for it

Name: Severe punishment, permanent physical damage, or killed
Description: Severe punishment, e.g., permanent physical damage, but she can be killed or divorced for it

Name: The woman is killed or commits suicide
Description: The woman is killed or commits suicide

Name: Both the lover and the woman is punished, the man is worse
Description: Both the woman and her lover are punished, but the lover is punished more severely than the woman

Name: Both the man and the woman are equally punished
Description: Both the woman and her lover are punished by almost equally severe punishment

Name: Both the woman and her lover are punished, woman more severe
Description: Both the woman and her lover are punished, but the woman is punished more severely than her lover
Some information, but insufficient to code

Name: The husband punishes his wife and/or her lover
Description: The husband punishes his wife and/or her lover, if the wife is not punished

Name: A representative of the wife's family punishes her
Description: A representative of the family or kin group of the wife punishes her

Name: The community as a whole or its representative punishes her
Description: The community as a whole or its representative punishes her

Name: Supernatural  consequences fall upon the woman
Description: Supernatural consequences fall upon the woman, e.g., mystical retribution or punishment by the ancestral gods

Name: 12-15 years
Description: 12-15 years (if the source says that boys or girls marry at puberty, code it here)

Name: 12-15 years
Description: 12-15 years (if the source says that boys or girls marry at puberty, code it here)

Name: Bilateral considerations, including not marrying a relative
Description: Bilateral considerations, including not marrying a relative

Name: Bilateral consideration, specifically cross&parrallel cousin
Description: Bilateral considerations, specifically cross and parallel cousins

Name: Kinship of a matrilineal or matrilateral nature
Description: Kinship of a matrilineal or matrilateral nature

Name: Kinship of a patrilineal or patrilateral nature
Description: Kinship of a patrilineal or patrilateral nature

Name: Locality where the potential spouse belongs
Description: Locality where the potential spouse lives

Name: The age or generation of the potential spouse
Description: The age or generation of the potential spouse

Name: The status of the potential spouse
Description: The status of the potential spouse

Name: The bride's family or a relative of the bride
Description: The brides family or a relative of the bride

Name: The groom's kin group and the bride's family
Description: The grooms kin group and the brides family

Name: The kin groups of the bride and groom
Description: The kin groups of the bride and groom

Name: Propective spouse's consent is necessay
Description: Propective spouses consent is necessary, i.e., the marriage cannot take place without it

Name: The prospective spouse is not consulted
Description: The prospective spouse is not consulted

Name: Propective spouse's consent is necessary
Description: Propective spouses consent is necessary, i.e., the marriage cannot take place without it

Name: The prospective spouse is not consulted
Description: The prospective spouse is not consulted

Name: Small celebration
Description: There is a small celebration, e.g., a minor acknowledgement or exchange of gifts

Name: Moderate celebration
Description: There is a moderate celebration, e.g., a feast, dancing, dramatic performances, or extensive gift exchange

Name: Elaborate celebration
Description: There is an elaborate celebration, e.g., it lasts a long period of time, is characterized by lavish dress, has elaborate performances, etc

Name: Family of the bride & groom
Description: The family of the bride or the groom

Name: Kin group of the bride or groom
Description: The kin group of the bride or groom

Name: Families of the bride & groom
Description: The families of the bride and groom

Name: Kin groups or "relatives" of the bride & groom
Description: The kin groups or relatives of the bride and groom

Name: RIghts concerning priority of sxual access
Description: Rights concerning priority of sexual access

Name: Rights concerning choice of resident & economic labor

Description: Rights concerning choice of residence and economic labor

Name: Rights concerning proirity of sexual access
Description: Rights concerning priority of sexual access

Name: Rights concerning choice of residence & economic labor
Description: Rights concerning choice of residence and economic labor

Name: After children or children of the appropriate sex are born
Description: After children or children of the appropriate sex are born

Name: After cohabitation & the birht of children
Description: After cohabitation and the birth of children

Name: After children are born & after bride price is paid
Description: After children are born and after bride price is paid

Name: Reproductive problems
Description: Reproductive problems, e.g., barrenness or impotence

Name: Failure in economic or domestic duties
Description: Failure in economic or domestic duties, e.g., laziness, poor provider or nonpayment of marriage payments
None or trivial grounds, e.g., another woman or man is more desirable or he or she does not like his or her current spouse

Name: Reproductive problems
Description: Reproductive problems, e.g., barrenness or impotence

Name: Failure in economic or domestic duties
Description: Failure in economic or domestic duties, e.g., laziness, poor provider or nonpayment of marriage payments

Name: None or trival grounds
Description: None or trivial grounds, e.g., another woman or man is more desirable or he or she does not like his or her current spouse

Name: Divorce is allowed for both H and W
Description: Divorce is allowed for both the H and W

Name: Divorce is more difficult for a man to obtain
Description: Divorce is more difficult for a man to obtain. There is a prohibition against his obtaining one or a low frequency of men who obtain a divorce

Name: Divorce is difficult and/or has a low frequenct for both H&W
Description: Divorce is difficult and/or has a low frequency for both men and women

Name: Divorce is more difficult for the wife to obtain
Description: Divorce is more difficult for the wife to obtain. There is a prohibition against her obtaining one or a low frequency of wives obtaining a divorce

Name: Wife keeps all the children
Description: The wife keeps all of the children

Name: Custody of chidren depend on age and who they wan to be with
Description: Who has custody of the children depends on the age and/or wishes of the children, e.g., the mother may take the infants

Name: Each spouse has custody of some of the children
Description: Each spouse has custody of some of the children, e.g., the wife keeps the girls and the husband the boys

Name: Custudy depend on the circumstances of the divorce
Description: Custody of the children depends on the circumstances of the divorce

Name: THe husband has custody of all of the children
Description: The husband has custody of all of the children

Name: Both H and W may remarry
Description: Both the H and W may remarry

Name: Both the H and W may remarry, but easier for H
Description: Both the H and W may remarry, but it is easier for the H

Name: It is difficult for both the H and W to remarry after divorc
Description: It is difficult for both the H and W to remarry after divorce

Name: No financial transactiond occur after a divorce, equal share
Description: No financial transactions occur after a divorce, or there is an equal division of property

Name: The H or his kin pay compensation
Description: The H or his kin pay compensation

Name: The transictiond that occur depend on the circumstances
Description: The transactions that occur depend on the circumstances of the divorce

Name: The wife and/or her kin group pay compensation
Description: The wife and/or her kin group pay compensation, e.g., return brideprice

Name: She may remarry anyone she chooses
Description: She may marry anyone she chooses

Name: May remarry but often chooses not to
Description: She may remarry but often chooses not to, e.g., she would suffer financial loss or her children can care for her

Name: May remarry, 1st priority is to husband kin
Description: She may remarry, but first priority is given to marrying a specific relative of her husbands or someone chosen by her husbands kin group, e.g., levirate

Name: May remarry, most be husband relative, or chosen by H kin
Description: She must marry a specific relative of the husbands or someone chosen by her husbands kin group or not remarry
Some information, but insufficient to code

Name: 6 months to less than a year
Description: 6 months to less than a year

Name: Elders in communtiy ( often elder males for boys, vice versa
Description: Elders in community (often elder males for boys, elder females for girls)

Name: Adults in household or community (other than parents)
Description: Adults in household or community (other than parents)

Name: Elders in community (often elder males for boys, vive versa)
Description: Elders in community (often elder males for boys, elder females for girls)

Name: Adults in household or community (other than parents)
Description: Adults in household or community (other than parents)

Name: Elders in community
Description: Elders in community (often elder males for boys, elder females for girls)

Name: Peers, age-mates, older youths, but not siblings
Description: Peers, age-mates, older youths, but not siblings

Name: Signigicant continuity (Minor elements only of discontinuity
Description: Significant continuity (Minor elements only of discontinuity)

Name: Significant continuity (Minor elements only of discontinuity
Description: Significant continuity (Minor elements only of discontinuity)

Name: Significant continuity (Minor elements only of discontinuity
Description: Significant continuity (Minor elements only of discontinuity)

Name: Change as result of world-sysytem contact
Description: Change as result of world-system contact

Name: Civil War, in absence of fueding or other internal wars
Description: Civil War, in the absense of feuding or other types of internal war (may include civil disorder, uprisising)

Name: Agriculuture not practiced or confined to non-food crops
Description: Agriculture not practiced or confined to non-food crops

Name: Agricultureal not practiced or confines to non-food crops
Description: Agriculture not practiced or confined to non-food crops

Name: Agriculture not practiced or confined to non-food crops
Description: Agriculture not practiced or confined to non-food crops

Name: Plow-positive(Buckwheat, Wheat, Barley, Wet Rice, Rye, Teff)
Description: Plow-positive (Buckwheat, Wheat, Barley, Wet Rice, Rye,

Name: Agriculture not practiced or confined to non-food crops
Description: Agriculture not practiced or confined to non-food crops

Name: less than 10%of land used per year
Description: less than 10 pct of land used per year

Name: 10%-29% of land used per year
Description: 10 pct - 29 pct of land used per year

Name: 30%- 49% of land used per year
Description: 30 pct - 49 pct of land used per year

Name: 50% -99% of land used per year
Description: 50 pct - 99 pct of land used per year

Name: 100% or more of land used per year
Description: 100 pct or more of land used per year, (over 100 pct due to double cropping)

Name: Despotism absent: bias in the resolution of individual
Description: Despotism absent: bias in the resolution of individual conflicts is not extreme, usually being effected by differences in strength, kinship connections, or wealth between the individuals involved.

Name: Depotism present: Conflicts of interest among individuals
Description: Despotism present: Conflicts of interest among individuals are resolved with extreme bias, one individual being immune from sanction or even from accusation for major offenses (such as murder), while the other may incur severe punishment, even death, for trivial offenses (such as insult), or for no reason at all.

Name: Perquisistes are small, reward less than a bride price
Description: Perquisites are small, the reward in a single case being roughly less than a bride price or a bride.

Name: Perguisites are substantial, greater/equal to bride price
Description: Perquisites are substantial, reward in a single case is roughly greater than or equal to a bride price or a bride.

Name: Low threat of severe natural disrupters of the food supply
Description: Low threat of famine in the 25-year time period - food is reported to be ample or adequate, with no report of famine; or famine occurred only in the past; or occasional periods of food shortage are reported, but the scare foods are reported to be replaced by other available foods; or there may be chronic hunger in the absence of the conditions immediately below (original scores 2-4) (original code 1)

Name: Moderate threat of severe natural disrupters of food supply
Moderately high threat of severe natural disrupters food sup
Description: Moderate threat of famine - there is no reported famine during the 25-year time period, but the ethnographer states that there is an ever present threat of famine (original code 2)

Name: high
Description: Moderately high threat of famine - one famine occurred during the 25-year time period (original code 3)

Name: High - more than one famine/the 25-year time period
Description: High - more than one famine occurred during the 25-year time period (original code 4)

Name: Low threat of severre natural disrupters of the food supply
Description: Low threat of severe natural disrupters of the food supply

Name: Moderate threat of severe natural disrupters of food supply
Description: Moderate threat of severe natural disrupters of food supply

Name: Moderate high threat of severe natural disrupters of food su
Description: Moderately high threat of severe natural disrupters of food supply

Name: There are some "hungry times" during the year food is scarce
Description: There are some hungry times during the year when people complain that they do not have enough food or enough of a particular food (original code 2)

Name: Some members of the population do not have enough to eat
Description: Some members of the population usually do not have enough to eat (original code 3)

Name: Most members of the pop. usually do not have enough to eat
Description: Most members of the population usually do not have enough to eat - i.e., they are chronically undernourished (original code 4)

Name: Absent
Description: secondary contact with the body or bones of the deceased does not occur.

Name: present:  return home
Description: secondary contact with the body or bones of the deceased is accorded only to individuals who are members of the society, but are not resident with their group of orientation at the time of death (e.g., an adult member has married and resides with his/her spouse at some distance from the group of orientation; or death occurs while the individual is on a trip away from the group of orientation). The body must be returned to the group of orientation for proper burial. Incidental to the returning process, the body decomposes and secondary disposal results.

Name: present: circumstances
Description: secondary contact with the body or bones is practiced, with circumstances of death (e.g., struck by lightening, time of year) being the only determinant of whether or not it is accorded to an individual.

Name: present: status determines
Description: secondary contact with the body or bones is the preferred means of disposal for a proportion of the population, with status, age-grade, kin, or sodality associations determining if it is accorded to an individual.

Name: present: almost all
Description: secondary contact with the body or bones is the preferred means of disposal for all or nearly all adult members of the society.

Name: Absent
Description: disarticulation does not occur or is not recoverable archaeologically.

Name: present: return home
Description: disarticulation of human osseous remains occurs prior to final disposal in the case of individuals who are members of the society, but are not resident with their group of orientation at the time of death. The body must be returned to the group of orientation for proper burial. Incidental to the returning process, the body decomposes and the result is a mass of disarticulated bones, which must be disposed of.

Name: present: timing
Description: disarticulation of human osseous remains occurs prior to final disposal only in situations where circumstances of death dictate that the body be curated until a time that is propitious for final disposal.

Name: present: status determines
Description: disarticulation of human osseous remains occurs prior to final disposal in a proportion of instances, with status, age-grade, kin, or sodality associations being the determining factor.

Name: prsent: nearly all
Description: disarticulation of human osseous remains occurs prior to final disposal in all or nearly all instances of adult deaths.

Name: Vary year-year
Description: The food sources utilized by the society are notably constant from year to year, season to season, and day to day, so that an adequate supply for daily needs is regularly available by the expenditure of a reasonable amount of effort

Name: Constant yr-vary seas
Description: The food sources are constant from year to year and season to season, but there is substantial diurnal variation in the available supply, owing to chance factors such as the success or failure of hunters on particular days

Name: Constant seas-year
Description: The food sources though relatively constant from year to year, vary markedly from season to season depending upon such climatic and ecological factors as sharp contrasts between hot and cold or wet and dry seasons and great differences in the seasonal availability of plant or animal food, or both kinds of foods

Name: Constant day-seas-yr
Description: The food sources, whatever their diurnal and seasonal variation, are markedly variable from year to year. Owing to extreme annual differences in rainfall or other recurrent but unpredictable climatic vicissitudes

Name: Absent
Description: There is no reciprocity within the society

Name: Balanced
Description: Food and/or chattels are predominantly distributed on a balanced or equal basis, i.e., donors and recipients reverse roles on a fairly equal basis and contribute and receive food and/or chattels more or less equally

Name: Generalized
Description: Food and/or chattels are predominantly distributed on a generalized basis, i.e., some people possess or have access to much more food and/or many more chattels than other people. A pattern obtains where the possessors of plenty are generalized donors and those who possess less are generalized recipients. The recipients do not reciprocate to the donors in amount

Name: Negative
Description: Food and/or chattels are predominantly distributed on a negative basis, i.e., some people possess or have access to much more food and/or many more chattels than other people. A pattern obtains where the possessors of plenty provide for the needy as the exigencies dictate; but the needy recipients, in turn, pay back a greater quantity of food and/or chattels to the original donor than they received (The return payment may be deferred for a season or more

Name: 2 and 3
Description: Both 2 and 3 obtain, neither clearly predominates

Name: 2 and 4
Description: Both 2 and 4 obtain, neither clearly predominates

Name: 3 and 4
Description: Both 3 and 4 obtain, neither clearly predominates

Name: Absent
Description: There is no redistribution of chattels and/or food

Name: Not nec kin or hhh
Description: Food and/or chattels are collected predominantly by individuals who are not necessarily lineage, deme, nor household heads, and these objects are then redistributed among the people in the local residence  group--among kin and/or nonkin

Name: Reps of kin groups
Description: Food and/or chattels are collected predominantly by individuals who are lineage, deme, or household heads, and these objects are then redistributed among the people in the local residence group--among kin and/or nonkin

Name: Reps local res group
Description: Food and/or chattels are collected predominantly by individuals who represent the local residence group as a whole (such as chief, village headman, and the like) rather than simply a deme, lineage, or household, and these objects are then redistributed among the people in the local residence group--among kin and/or nonkin

Name: 2 and 3
Description: Both 2 and 3 are practiced, neither clearly predominates

Name: 2 and 4
Description: Both 2 and 4 are practiced, neither clearly predominates

Name: 3 and 4
Description: Both 3 and 4 are practiced, neither clearly predominates

Name: 2, 3 and 4
Description: 2, 3, and 4 are practiced, none clearly predominates

Name: Communal or free
Description: Most local food resources are viewed as being either communal property or free and available to all

Name: Prv units,access all
Description: Most local food resources such as animals on specific tidewater flats, roots on specific grounds, fields of corn, are viewed as being private properties of units within the local community, such as demes, lineages, or households, yet access to these resources is provided to other units within the local community

Name: Prv units,restricted
Description: Most local food resources such as fish and shellfish on tidewater flats, roots on specific grounds, fields of corn and beans, are viewed as being private properties of units within the local community, such as demes, lineages, or households, access to these resources is not provided to other units within the local community

Name: Priv ind, access all
Description: Most local food resources are viewed as being private properties of individual persons within the local communities, yet access to these resources is provided to other people within the local community

Name: Priv ind, restricted
Description: Most local food resources are viewed as being private properties of individual persons, and access to these resources is not provided to other people within the local community

Name: 2 and 4
Description: Both 2 and 4 are present, neither clearly predominates

Name: 2 and 5
Description: Both 2 and 5 are present, neither clearly predominates

Name: 3 and 4
Description: Both 3 and 4 are present, none clearly predominates

Name: 3 and 5
Description: Both 3 and 5 are present, none clearly predominates

Name: 1, 2, and 4
Description: 1, 2, and 4 are present, none clearly predominates

Name: No ceremony
Description: Reciprocity, but no ceremonialism of any sort

Name: Ceremony present
Description: Ceremonialism is present when food and/or chattels are reciprocated; e.g., the recipient returns food and/or chattels to the original donor in a particular way at an appropriate time

Name: 2 and 3
Description: Both reciprocity without ceremonialism and ceremonialism

Name: No redistribution
Description: No redistribution of food and/or chattels

Name: No ceremony
Description: Redistribution in which there is no ceremonialism of any sort and in which recipients of food and/or chattels are treated about equally

Name: Cer w eq treat, food
Description: Redistribution with ceremony in which the donor provides food for the ceremony, and all who attend receive about equal shares regardless of differences in status, rank, or kinship

Name: Cer eq,food-chattels
Description: Redistribution in which there is ceremonialism and in which recipients of food and/or chattels are treated about equally

Name: Cer w diff treatment
Description: Redistribution in which there is some ceremonialism and in which recipients receive food and/or chattels differentially; e.g., nonkin receive more than kin or vice versa, the people of highest rank receive more than those of lowest rank, the people with the greatest prestige are the first to receive gifts, and so forth

Name: No or few priv prop
Description: No or few privately owned food resources and/or chattels

Name: No intracommunty use
Description: No intracommunity use of privately owned food resources and/or chattels permitted; therefore no ceremonialism

Name: No ceremony
Description: No ceremonialism or etiquette is involved in exploiting food resources or using chattels recognized as belonging to others

Name: Some ceremony
Description: Some ceremonialism or etiquette is involved in gaining access to the food resources or the use of chattels recognized as belonging to others; e.g., invitations are extended, use is requested, affines are expected to use the resources and/or chattels, and so forth

Name: Absent
Description: There is no reciprocity between or among extralocal groups

Name: Balanced, donor-rec
Description: Food and/or chattels are predominantly distributed on a balanced or equal basis, i.e., donors and recipients reverse roles on a fairly equal basis and contribute and receive food and/or chattels more or less equally

Name: Generalized donor
Description: Food and/or chattels are predominantly distributed on a generalized basis, i.e., people in the local group possess or have access to much more food and/or many more chattels than people in another local group. A pattern obtains where the possessors of plenty are generalized donors and those who possess less are generalized recipients.  The recipients do not reciprocate to the donors in amount

Name: Negative donor
Description: Food and/or chattels are predominantly distributed on a negative basis, i.e., people in the local group possess or have access to much more food and/or many more chattels than people in other local groups. A pattern obtains where the possessors of plenty provide for the needy as the exigencies dictate; but the needy recipients, in turn, pay back as negative donors a greater quantity of food and/or chattels to the original donor than they received (The return payment may be deferred for a season or more

Name: General recipient
Description: Generalized reciprocity (as in #3) in which the local group is the generalized recipient rather than the donor

Name: Negative recipient
Description: Negative reciprocity (as in #4) in which the local group is the negative recipient of food and/or chattels from a group that possesses plenty (or from several groups), rather than being the possessors and donors of plenty themselves

Name: 2 and 3
Description: Both 2 and 3 obtain, neither clearly predominates

Name: 3 and 4
Description: Both 3 and 4 obtain, none clearly predominates

Name: Absent
Description: No extralocal redistribution of chattels and/or food involves the local group as donor or as recipient

Name: Loc rec, do not give
Description: Members of the local group receive food and/or chattels redistributed by members of other communities (extralocal groups), but the local group does not redistribute--i.e., does not serve as a donor

Name: Ind(not kin), redist
Description: Food and/or chattels are collected predominantly by individual persons who are not necessarily lineage, deme, or household heads, and these objects are then redistributed among people from other communities (extralocal residence-groups)

Name: Kin reps redistribute
Description: Food and/or chattels are collected predominantly by individual persons who are lineage, deme, or household heads, and these objects are then redistributed among people from other communities (extralocal residence-groups)

Name: Reps loc grp redist
Description: Food and/or chattels are collected predominantly by individuals persons who represent the local residence group as a whole (such as chief, village headman, and the like) rather than simply a deme, lineage, or household, and these objects are  then redistributed among people from other communities (extralocal residence-groups)

Name: No access given
Description: No access to local food resources is given to people from different extralocal groups

Name: Communal and free
Description: Most local food resources are viewed as being communal property, or as free and available to all, and access to these resources is extended to people from other communities (extralocal groups)

Name: Priv unit,access yes
Description: Most local food resources re viewed as being private properties of units within the local community, such as demes, lineages, or households, yet access to these resources is provided to people from other communities (extralocal groups)

Name: Priv ind,access yes
Description: Most local food resources are viewed as being private properties of individuals within the local community, yet access to these resources is provided to people from other communities (extralocal groups)

Name: 2 and 3
Description: Both 2 and 3 are present, neither clearly predominates

Name: 3 and 4
Description: Both 3 and 4 are present, neither clearly predominates

Name: No ceremony
Description: Reciprocity between individuals from different communities, but no ceremonialism of any sort

Name: Ceremony present
Description: Ceremonialism is present when food and/or chattels are reciprocated; e.g., the recipient from one community returns food and/or chattels to the original donor in another community in a particular way at an appropriate time

Name: Rec between leaders
Description: Reciprocity between ceremonial or political leaders of localized community units, such as patrilineages and patriclans, patridemes, the matriunits, and less structured communities

Name: No redistribution
Description: No intercommunity redistribution of food and/or chattels

Name: No cer, eq treatment
Description: Redistribution among people from more than one community accompanied with no ceremonialism of any sort; the recipients of food and/or chattels are treated about equally by the donor

Name: Cer w diff treatment
Description: Redistribution among people from more than one community accompanied with some ceremonialism; recipients receive food and/or chattels differentially, e.g. affines receive more than kin or vice versa, the people of highest rank receive more than people of lesser rank, the people with the greatest prestige are the first to receive gifts, or the people who have traveled the farthest to visit the hosts are the first to receive goods, or they receive the most goods, or both

Name: Cer w eq treat
Description: Redistribution among people from more than one community accompanied with ceremonialism; the recipients of food and/or chattels are treated about equally by the donor

Name: No or few priv prop
Description: No or few privately owned food resources and/or chattels

Name: No intercommunty use
Description: No intercommunity use of privately owned food resources and/or chattels

Name: No ceremony
Description: No ceremonialism nor etiquette is involved in allowing people from other communities (extralocal groups) to exploit food resources or use chattels recognized as belonging to the host-group (or members of the host-group)

Name: Some ceremony
Description: Some ceremonialism or etiquette is involved in allowing people from other communities to exploit food resources or use chattels recognized as belonging to the host-group(or members of the host-group), e.g., invitations are extended, or requests are granted, affines are expected to use the hosts' resources and/or chattels, joint use or exploitation is accompanied by feasting, dancing, and so forth

Name: Absent
Description: Barter or trade, replete with higgle-haggle over value does not occur.

Name: Barter,no stnd-hghgl
Description: Barter or trade, but no mention of standardized values or higgle-haggle

Name: Gift frnd,barg strng
Description: Barter or trade as reciprocal gift-giving between friends, but with bargaining between strangers

Name: Brt w hghgl, nonkin
Description: Barter or trade, replete with higgle-haggle over value for food and/or chattels occurs, but only between people who are not close kin

Name: Bartr w kin & nonkin
Description: Barter for food and/or chattels occurs among kin and nonkin, especially between craft specialists and their clients

Name: Absent
Description: No gift exchange occurs, or if it occurs it is negligible

Name: With any person
Description: Gift exchange regardless of kinship or rank

Name: Between kin & affines
Description: Gift exchange for food and/or chattels occurs predominantly between kin and affines (exchange may be deferred)

Name: Between similar ranks
Description: Gift exchange for food and/or chattels occurs predominantly between people of similar rank

Name: 3 and 4
Description: Both 3 and 4 obtain, neither clearly predominating

Name: Absent
Description: Barter or trade, replete with higgle-haggle over value, does not occur

Name: Barter,no stnd-hghgl
Description: Barter or trade, but no mention of standardized values or higgle-haggle

Name: Gift frnd,barg strng
